intro: Sphaeralcea subrhomboidea, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, and it produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Sphaeralcea subrhomboidea is often found in sandy or rocky soils, and it plays a role in stabilizing desert ecosystems.
